review:
Some bits good and useful - time in bed, steps, period tracker. You need additional gadgets to monitor e.g. sleep and heart rate obviously. It shows long term data clearly and  predicts period well once you‚Äôve inputted a few previous cycles.
There needs to be a section for pollen allergy/ hay fever. Then like periods, you could track your symptoms, whether you‚Äôve taken antihistamines, and even better if it could link to the met pollen forecast and let you know what expected pollen counts are or even notify you if they are very high.
Also the nutrition section is good for tracking nutritional intake if you link it to another app, but it would be better if you could set your daily allowance and have it as a line on the graph e.g recommended calorie intake, max sodium intake, sugar, sat fats etc and give notifications to let you know if you‚Äôve exceeded or how your trends are. Ideally you could select which nutrient values you‚Äôre interested in (as the list available is very long) and have a summary page with the graphs for those all visible one after another.
title: Some bits good, needs hayfever section + better nutrition

review:
To say I‚Äôm shocked at how bad this app is, would be an understatement. It‚Äôs overly complex, unattractive and poorly thought out. The sleep tracking is terrible. Unless you set a sleep schedule it doesn‚Äôt track your sleep.  Not everyone wants a sleep schedule!  And when it is tracking, it‚Äôs often incorrect and mixes up time in bed with being asleep, or vice versa. It doesn‚Äôt track type of sleep, e.g. REM v deep sleep, and doesn‚Äôt tell you how many hours/minutes of sleep you get, you have to work that out for yourself. 
The exercise and non exercise calorie trackers are separate rather than in one place, WHY?? The heart health tells you a whole load of info but doesn‚Äôt inform you what it means, e.g. it gives a score for how fast your heart rate drops after you stop exercising but not what the National average or mean/norm is. Much of the heart health tracking is similar, lots of scores and info but not what any of it means, so nothing to compare with. Guess I need to go and get a medical degree in heart health! 
I really, really dislike it and in comparison to Fitbit health tracker and app, Apple Health is useless and a very poorly designed offer. I will not replace my Apple Watch once it wears out because of the app. I‚Äôll go back to Fitbit!
title: Surprisingly Awful!

review: Medication tracking is very helpful but quite basic. The graphs are primitive and don‚Äôt show you proper frequency (for example it only shows days of the week taken but not hours in between), you can‚Äôt take medication at different hours (I need to take mine Friday morning and Monday evening), if you need to change the dose during the month at a regular intervals it‚Äôs not possible, taking a medication for X days every month is also not a thing. For all the supposed female focus, the app lacks basic things like cycling hormonal medication. I understand that Apple is trying catch the largest use case, but taking medication every day isn‚Äôt rocket science, a simple reminder would do fine. It‚Äôs the more complicated options that require specialised tooling and this app falls drastically short.
title: Medication tracking is quite basic

review:
Using this app mainly for cycle tracking, but also for tracking fitness. Really disappointed at how clunky it is, and the very poor and unorganised layout. The algorithm is also very inaccurate - I.e. predicted period does not change when logging clear signs of ovulation. At the minute I am using a third party app to feed in the information as it is much more user friendly, but I am concerned about my data which is why I would prefer via apple.
I also think the sleep tracker is really inaccurate. Lots of sleep logged when I have actually been awake, while wearing the new Apple Watch as well. 

 Suggestions:
- big big improvement in AI and algorithms to track and predict ovulation/period
- ability to view cycle as calendar 
- view of what day in your cycle you are on at a glance
- nearly having cycle tracking as a stand along app would be better as it is such a big thing for half the population! 
- wrist temp should be used alongside cycle data to help correlate between period/cervical mucous changes to allow for better tracking
- wrist temp displayed as the temperature rather than change from baseline - my baseline started just before I ovulated and therefore baseline is not accurate. Not sure if this will be my baseline forever or if AI will sort this issue out.
- organising favourites in summary by group rather than by alphabetical order

I‚Äôm desperate for health to be great, but at the minute it is a big flop üëéüèª
title: Please please make this better!!

review:
I am disappointed with the updates to the Health App following the recent iOS software update.  The app is only available on iPhone (not iPad) and you have now put so much information on the display it is cluttered and untidy.  For me ‚Äì this App worked.  I want it for step count and not much more.  I find it quite accurate and use it frequently.

Why have you now added a 6-month data tab to the graph?  And why have you added a Trend button?  Which currently shows as unavailable!

These both take up space, the graph is squashed making it difficult to read, and I fail to see what they add to the app.  If it ain‚Äôt broke, why fix it?  Please remove these (in my opinion) unnecessary additions.
title: Disappointed with unnecessary upgrade

review: Health is an incredibly powerful app! One thing that I love about it is its modern design with rounded corners. It makes all of the rich information that is being presented to me feel minimised and unobtrusive. Speaking of information, I love everything that is being displayed to me and everything that I can do with it. At a glance, I can see my activity, sleep and amount of steps. One of the apps highlighting features for me is its tight integration with the Apple Watch, which is my ultimate health companion. I can easily see a quick summary of all of my health data collected by my watch such as my Activity Rings and Handwashing. Overall, Health is a very useful app and I feel like it should be used more by users!
title: Very Useful!

review:
In my opinion I do like it more now
1) prefers some stats over the garmin connect
In garmin everything is in one place but if you want to compare some stats then you need to go back and back again with health app there are shortcuts which can give me quicker access. However I wish If there could be more shortcuts so for example I could see my weight against my performance on the gym (load) and my calories in vs out or even macro visibility to see if any of this factors have impact on my training. 
Right now there is a lot to input like vitamins, carbs, then we can see sleep and activities but if I will be able to create relations between this stats without going in and out out it would be fantastic ü§©
title: Right direction but not there yet‚Ä¶.

review: I have set myself the goal of walking 10,000 steps a day and make sure that I achieve this everyday.  I want to celebrate that achievement but instead I get lots of messages telling me I have not walked as far as yesterday - last week - last month - last year.  My aim is 10,000 steps, anything else is a bonus and I am not resetting my goal.  It is a shame I cannot enter my goal and have my achievement celebrated. I agree with a previous reviewer who suggested the current day should not be included in the weekly totals as it skews the average when you have not walked anywhere yet.  Positive feedback or the ability to turn the messages off would improve this app for me.
title: Would be good if it was more encouraging

review:
I must say, I‚Äôve recently moved from a Fitbit activity tracker to an Apple Watch series7 & I love the watch, however I did think Fitbit displayed the data better in its app. I however may just need some time to get used to the differences.
I would really like another category to be added please‚Ä¶. Total calorie burn for each day, week, month etc.
I understand that I can add it up (active energy+resting energy), but it‚Äôs a nuisance having to do so & I could really do with quick reference & graphic comparisons.
There are sooooo many categories, there really is something for everyone & the fact that you can tailor your dashboard really helps üòå
title: New Interface (takes time to get used to)

review: Like the app and step count seems quite accurate. A couple of things that could make it better 1) instant refresh of step count data when opening app - there is often a lag of several minutes and doesn‚Äôt seem to be a refresh/sync option to force the count to update 2) the longer term average step count chart/dat includes the current days data- it would be better if it didn‚Äôt so that longer term averages aren‚Äôt skewed by the current day ie. In the morning when number of steps is much lower than it would be at the end of the day, the long run average daily steps is lower.( Would suggest taking current day out)
title: Step Count

review: I don‚Äôt have a smart watch but even without one this app has some extremely helpful features like the period tracker. It also integrates well with my asthma app making it easy to track and visualise trends in my peak flow. The medications reminders are really helpful but need improvement. It isn‚Äôt useful for tracking HRT because you can‚Äôt set a monthly cycle where you take pills for 12 days each month. It would be great if the app could calculate when I should start and stop taking them in every 28 days. Different HRT plans have different stop/start lengths so if Apple could add this feature I‚Äôd change my review to 5 stars.
title: Good but could be even better

review:
One of my medication requires to be taken at regular intervals - 3 day with 4 hours in between. But it doesn‚Äôt have to be the exact time everyday. As long as it‚Äôs 4 hours after I‚Äôve taken the first one in the morning.

I know a lot of people take similar meds and it would be really helpful to have a function where the medication reminder automated based on whenever the first pill of the day
title: Please improve medication tracking

review:
Enjoying the data it‚Äôs gathering. Would be good to have guidance on nutrient intake etc on the analysis/dashboard. Also - as someone with Crohns, having the ability to input Bowel movements would be great. I use an app called Bowelle, which records lots of information and reads/writes into the app, but not actual Bowel Motions. It‚Äôd be good to have something like this, so I can see if things are influencing my well-being and health easier.
Edit - would also be good to be able to overlay data graphs. Eg I‚Äôve had a sore throat, which I‚Äôve entered, would be good to overlay that across over data, eg sleep, nutrition etc, to see if there‚Äôs a decrease/increase and maybe a reason for symptoms
title: Good start

review:
To the Apple Developers of the Health App. 

In certain ways I find it extremely helpful if I can write a small note when inputting manual data. An example would be in the Blood Pressure data. 

The input ‚ÄòAdd Data‚Äô in this case limits the user to fixed strings (a date, a time a reading).

The addition of a simple Note text box would be of immense value. Limited, say to 20 Characters.

A high reading cannot be expanded on. It may be higher than normal but there‚Äôs a good reason, a note text box would allow me to ‚Äòqualify‚Äô such an anomaly.
 
This feedback is applicable to all aspects of the Health App where it isn‚Äôt obvious why numbers are unusual or unexpected. I would then rate as ***** Stars.

The App is an extremely well developed piece of work, and I‚Äôm enormously grateful to be able to record my health activity, using it with my Apple Watch. Maybe you could consider this suggestion in a future update, thanks guys.
title: Apple Health App - Feedback

review:
I have been using the apple health app for the last 6months to keep track of weight, temperatures, periods etc etc. Until now I didn‚Äôt have any complaints, it was easy enough to add data and I used other apps to view/analyse the data.
This morning I tried to add a temperature but the app stopped working, the dashboard only showed yesterdays values, I couldn‚Äôt add new data, the graphs were empty, and when I tried to ‚Äúshow all data‚Äù it got stuck on a spinning disc. Only a full restart of my iPhone14pro would resolve it and get the data back, and even that only worked for 30mins before it stopped working again.
I don‚Äôt have the patience to restart my phone every time I use this app!
title: Shockingly unreliable

review: I noticed today, for the second time this month that the distance recorded was wrong.  This means probably distance and steps have been wrong all month and all my data on the exercise I have done walking and running is incorrect. I‚Äôve always felt this app was pretty accurate before but not any more. Also if the app using gps and Apple maps data to calculate distance does that mean that Apple maps is also wrong (consequences for driving). Extremely disappointed -  will now have to get a different app. It‚Äôs also put me off getting an Apple watch. What has happened?
title: Why suddenly so inaccurate?

review:
I use this app solely for tracing my reproductive cycle. It‚Äôs really helpful tracing symptoms of headaches, mood changes, etc and logging the different flow levels. I would love it to actually log am/pm or specific times of day where menstruation starts/stops.
It‚Äôs good for monitoring other health related stuff such as your fitness and step counter. I love that it synchs to your Lock Screen for emergencies and people can see your emergency contacts list. Very helpful.
title: Pretty good for monitoring reproductive health

review: I‚Äôve worked so hard over 3 years to improve my average daily step count for the year. This used to be displayed and it made me able to see how hard I had to work to achieve my goal for the year. Suddenly this info disappeared from the list of highlights and has never reappeared. What on earth is going on? If we‚Äôd had warning that this info would be hidden, I could have done the calculations myself, but I‚Äôve lost more than 8 months of data summary with this change. I‚Äôm bitterly disappointed and have lost all faith in the app.
title: Gutted!

review:
Come on folks, I actually TELL you via my watch when I‚Äôm settling down, but your sleep data still says I‚Äôm asleep before then (I‚Äôm not, I‚Äôm reading), and to compound the problem, you can‚Äôt edit the data. Your breakdown of sleep (deep, REM etc) is also way out. I‚Äôve used the ‚ÄúAutoSleep‚Äù App for some time, an it seems very accurate (at least it knows when I‚Äôm asleep). It uses the same data source (the watch), so just WHY is this App sleep data so bad?!?!?! 
Note: I‚Äôve also used Fitbit & Garmin as well, and they are better that the Health App at monitoring sleep.
title: Sleep data is HOPELESS!

review: I‚Äôm switching from a specific app to Medications in Health to monitor my prescription dosages, but in one respect there is a problem. The other app allows me to choose whether to record taking a medication with many options - reschedule, on time, taken now etc. In this app, if I inadvertently tap Taken on a medication, I cannot even undo the mistake. I simply have to remember it was not taken. Any chance of reviewing this?
title: Medications

review:
HRT, specifically progesterone isn‚Äôt generally taken non-stop. It is taken for a number of days, then stopped for a number of days and then taken again for a number of days. Need this cycle type to be added for medication reminders. 

Also have noticed that once the medication name and dosage has been added, you cannot edit the dosage if you have made a mistake. Please can you fix this. Thanks, Team.
title: Needs work to support women‚Äôs health

review: So I‚Äôve just got a new fossil 5e fitness tracker watch and tried to link the wear os by Google app to health, it started testing to connect then stopped responding. Now every time I try to go into it it just freezes and crashes. I tried to uninstall and reinstall but all that‚Äôs happened is it‚Äôs now no no longer on my Home Screen and I don‚Äôt know how to either add it again or stop it crashing or get it to pair with the wear os app! Very disappointed!
title: Just stopped working

review:
It‚Äôs not possible to set the amount of available pills and get a notification when they‚Äôre running low, this is really important for me as I need to remember to get the prescription two weeks in advance as there‚Äôs a very long queue to book an appointment.
It‚Äôs not possible to create one medication to be taken on a predefined set of days i.e. Monday, Wednesday and Friday.
Very poor design I‚Äôm afraid.
title: Medication section needs more features

review: It does it‚Äôs job of being a kind of secure central database for lots of health and workout related information from various sources, but there is no way to personalise the views in order to make all this information more intuitive. Being able to reorder the Favourites in the Summary would be so helpful‚Ä¶ Also, the Highlights probably deserve their own tab in the app, while Sleep data, recently introduced, is still very basic compared with what third party apps can show you.
title: Could be so much better

review:
I have somehow turned the font to large on the health app and try as I might, I can't get it back to normal. Don't tell me to go to Settings> accessibility and then something there, it's not working and it's not the whole iPhone, just this app. 
I was half asleep having added the medication I had just taken. I remember seeing an up and down slider and something about this ' just this app' and I just pressed something and now it's a mess to the point where I've tried to delete it but can't. Please help me, the forum has messages a decade old.
title: Really annoyed

review: Pretty decent app, should have loads more info on the things you track. Cycle tracking and medication tracking is probably the most useful thing this app has to offer. Kind of disappointing to say it‚Äôs from Apple though. Never had a ‚Äúproblem‚Äù with it. Just needs a bit more.
title: Decent app

review:
Before the update, i really like the app because it is tracking the real time i spent on the phone but now it tracks only when i set the schedule and this is the problem. When i set the schedule, the app weongly tracks the data. The app shows the time i put on schedule instead of real data. So, what is the point for using the app if it only shows the schedule not the real data tracking.

I really want the before update version back. 

And not only the sleep data that get worse. The pace tracking is also harder to read than before. Normally before the update, when i enter the app, it shows steps and sleep on that day right away. But now i have to tap on many buttons to get to see my steps count.

Please bring back the old version. This version is useless.
title: Poor Sleep tracking

review:
Great this app but there‚Äôs one big issue I have with it currently, and hope it can be fixed. I have set up medication notifications, which are vital, but when getting the reminder I‚Äôm missing it because there‚Äôs no/very quiet notification sound. 
I get notifications about winding down through the health app and they‚Äôre fine, perfectly loud enough. Please sort this as it‚Äôs really useful IF I get the notifications on time
title: Great but‚Ä¶

review:
Apple could really use a lesson in woman‚Äôs health. if you are offering a ‚Äòcycle tracker‚Äô you should know that a woman‚Äôs health goes beyond her fertile years. 
Try adding either an option to manually add a factor or automatically select more factors from your list which currently only offers these 3: pregnancy, lactation or contraceptive‚Ä¶
Women also go through menopause and then the fun continues‚Ä¶ I truly hope you will fix this major bug.
title: Menopause not in cycle tracking???

review: The frequency for medication can not be changed for weeks. So for the contraceptive pill, you take that for three weeks and miss the fourth. There is no option to do this which seems very limited as you can even do this on the reminders and calendar apps. For example I have medication I take for two weeks and then stop for two weeks.
title: Improvement to the medication frequency

review: Worst app in history it won‚Äôt let me turn it off and who ever went on my phone and made it sent the alarm for 9pm and to wake up at 6am so the wee poo that done this is gonna pay ma mum kicked me oot because every morning an alarm was making her pee the bed ever time she heard it so not a good app don‚Äôt set up make and the worst part is you can‚Äôt even Delete the app or turn it off it dosent even deserve the one star I gave it so erm apple let me not be homeless and let me move back in with my mum
title: Why not to set this up!

review:
All starred items are thrown into a list organised alphabetical. So you have food values mixed with medication mixed with body values impossible to find anything as you have to remember Apple names. 

When you select an item you have an annoying completely uninteresting about box covering half the page. I read it once - now get rid of it. 

Some of the graphs calculations are plainly wrong. Calculating days with missing entries as 0 which means the average value shown is wrong.
title: Hopeles disorganised ui

review: The app is great, but is let down by the poor sleep stats. Also it would be great to have an option in the medication part to track the quantity of tablets you have and when to re-order etc.
title: Good, but needs more features

review: When you add a medication that needs to be taken more than once per day the reminders do not work. The work around is you have to add each as a separate medication (e.g. Antibiotic1, Antibiotic2, etc). It‚Äôs annoying. In additional, once a medication is added you cannot edit the dosage (e.g. 50mg -> 500mg).
title: Medication reminders don‚Äôt work

review: Hi, Started using this app more now that I have an Apple Watch. Love the app generally but was wondering in the weigh section, instead of just having St for stones, you could have stones and pounds so tht I could record it more accurately. Having to work out the percentage that 8lbs are to a stone is frustrating.
title: Weight accuracy

review: I use this app to monitor my medical condition, it has stopped working in as much as the app opens and then freezes. It is also affecting the way my phone works (I uninstalled to find out), freezing my Dexcom app. I have had to carry out a forced restart 3 times now. I wouldn‚Äôt care if it did this if it didn‚Äôt interfere with the management of my condition.
title: Please fix bugs

review: I‚Äôve been monitoring walking data for 3 months, and the App consistently under-measures distance walked by 20% or more. My height and other data has been input. As a result I don‚Äôt trust the step data either. Such a shame as having the phone in my pocket is such an easy way to keep an eye on my daily exercise.
title: Undercooked

review: Need to be able to order the items in the menu in my chosen order. Example , medications needs to be first as it‚Äôs my most used. It‚Äôs also my data, I want ways to export it and use it OR make an app that offers full screen access to graphs, etc on iPad and mac
title: Needs improving, messy

review: This could be better. Not sure why apple chose not to work or improve certain apps. It‚Äôs about time this app has the features to track things properly withou having to synchronise third party apps. It has sections to add different nutrients but tells you to add them individually, when you could add food and it breaks it down like other apps. Come one apple!!! Work on this
title: Basic rubbish! Needs improvement!!!

review: This‚Äôll just be a lot easier than you can even imagine ,health is a big part of our lives as we get older it‚Äôll grow with it‚Äôs power and this amazing app will encourage you to reach for higher targets and control your self .ü§©
title: High five to health

review: A mediocre health app, does many things but only superficially. My main issue is that vo2 max is only calculated by walking and running activities. I‚Äôm a keen cyclist so there‚Äôs a big discrepancy between my actual vo2 max and the one reported in health. If this metric is calculated inefficiently I suspect others will be too.
title: Does everything superficially

review: I‚Äôve been using this feature - I know I‚Äôve been using it but the app seems to know differently!  I log a med as taken. I go back to log another one and it‚Äôs not showing the one I logged. If this happens over a few days and you miss it‚Äôs not tracking, it makes the app pointless. Getting frustrated with it.
title: Medication tracking

review:
I am using this app from a long time, but suddenly from few days this app is giving me wrong steps count, can you please help me to fix it..

Many thanks
title: Steps count incorrect

review: The trouble with this app it‚Äôs geared towards people who want to spend hours and hours exercising I‚Äôm 70 years old and comfortable with doing 3-4 miles per day but I‚Äôm constantly getting pushed to do more it‚Äôs made me ill so stopped using
title: Too much influence on making you go beyond your capabilities

review:
Love all the data the iOS version collects but it‚Äôs to constricted on a phone. With a really good desktop version of the app (not just a simple port) all that‚Äôs data could really be analysed and compared.

Make a desktop version Apple.
title: Needs a desktop version

review: I never use this app and decided to delete it, but it just comes up with ‚ÄòRemove from Home Screen‚Äô. I don‚Äôt want to remove it from my Home Screen, I want to delete it, but it just won‚Äôt do it. I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs an alright app, which is why I rated 3 stars, but it just won‚Äôt delete!
title: Can‚Äôt delete

review: I have noticed that the floors counter averages for weeks, months etc only using data from days when floors are climbed. This then gives a false average as it discounts non climbing days. Can this be fixed please.
title: Floors average problem

review: After researching and checking all setting and trying various so called fixes, I still cannot get this app to sync with WearPro app. There are times I do not want to take my phone just to get steps etc. Just another apple trick to try and force people to buy there overpriced watches. Deleted the app and use a different one now that is actually better as it turns out.
title: Poor

review: Log all as taken for a medication has stopped working or they changed it what it does. It used to mark all days as taken, now its the same as ‚Äútaken‚Äù button just for one day.
title: Broke

review:
Sleep does not work, does not show correct time spent in bed or any data regarding rem sleep etc. NOTHING!

Cardio fitness does not work, again shoes no data.

Cluttered UI

FULL of ADVERTS

Surely the people who designed this app can‚Äôt be so incompetent? I can only suppose you have deliberately made it this way too make users use 3rd party apps so that you benefit from the income stream theses app provide.

It does not help people to get fit when the Apple Health app itself is not fit for the purpose it is supposed to provide!

Provide uses of your expensive Phone / Watch combo a clutter free, easy to understand  way of recording and reviewing health activities,
title: An utter mess of an app, broken functions ‚Ä¶

review: This app is frustratingly slow to update things like step count and also frequently gives me warnings to turn my music down. This can‚Äôt be switched off on my phone even though it‚Äôs apparently possible, I have googled it. It has now started to turn my music down when it decides I‚Äôve had enough loud music. So annoying
title: Slow to update and bossy

review:
Clearly designed to integrate with multiple healthtech services, incremental design is def the right approach. Overall pretty good especially in combination with apple watch. 
My one pet peev for now is applets/widgets‚Ä¶. please add them for health!!
title: Not bad, attempts to do too much but solid foundation.

review: I work out a lot but often forget to switch on a workout on my watch. It used to be really easy to browse workouts and add them manually but this functionality is no longer available. Please bring it back!? It makes no sense to have removed it. From a disappointed product manager.
title: Manually added workouts removed! Why?

review: I have to input my running and walking distances manually since installing the update to IOS 15.1 on my iPhone 7. It just isn‚Äôt working. Even when I do the manual input, it changes the numbers so that it takes a few tries to get the distance right. Useless.
title: Doesn‚Äôt work after update to IOS 15.1 on iPhone 7

review: The information about how many days passed since the menstrual flow ended is so useless. The important information is when the cycle started, please change so it's that info in the summary.
title: Menstrual cycle tracker

review: Please make it possible to re arrange apps the way you want it on the front screen. Also the standing up stat is pretty useless and it would be better to have step count form the daily circle
title: Make it possible to rearrange apps

review: This is a great up but I wish it didn‚Äôt make you have to sign up in to everything. Because FYI, I‚Äôm not that sort of person. And it may need a few upgrades. Overall, it‚Äôs cool. üòé
title: Good but-

review: Has some really good trend data but forces you to turn on notifications. Feels like something from a growth hacking, user abusing, startup rather than something from Apple.
title: Requires notifications

review: Please let us reorder the dashboard so we can choose what we see at the top! I want to look at my steps the most but other info comes before this!
title: Needs an update

review: The sleep schedule is terrible - difficult to set, impossible to understand if set correctly, etc. Blood pressure tracking does not provide a basic chart tracking trajectory. No improvements with this app over time...just a relentless pursuit of complexity.  Adds near zero value for doctor and patient. I am both! Very disappointing.
title: Very disappointing

review: Started using this app when I started HRT but it doesn‚Äôt allow a way to put in reminders for complex & personalised series eg. Take one medication for 25 days then skip for a few.  Please fix this.
title: Mediations section needs improvement

review: What this stores about me is so wrong. For instance,  it says I‚Äôve been in bed for five hours when I know Ive been in bed for eight, at least. Some bits I don‚Äôt bother checking anymore as I know it will just grasp results from out of the air, so why bother!   Good as a pedometer and for storing names and numbers to be contacted in an emergency !
title: Rubbish

review: I have used this app for over 2 years and it has just stopped working. It won‚Äôt do the steps automatically and it appears to have stuck, including the time!!
title: I can‚Äôt use it

review:
I wish the period/cycle tracking was better. It‚Äôs so basic that it‚Äôs not the best for the bigger picture. 
Take a look at Clue for a good example. 
Rest of the app is ok but come on Apple you can do better.
title: Ok but could be so much better

review: Used to think the step count / km / mile function worked quite well using gps. During the last couple of months this feature fails to work accurately. Today I did an afternoon walk, something over 4 miles according to my car but less than 6000 steps according to the app. App now useless.
title: Out of step

review: I like being able to record my peak flow readings and inhaler usage, however a notes section would be useful to record why the asthma has flared
title: Notes section would be helpful for asthma

review:
First of all I never take my iPod anywhere so the steps thing is useless. The only thing I really use it for is the headphone volume thingymabob. Pretty soon I might have to start using the period tracking (im 11) and I‚Äôm kinda scared üò≥üò•

review:
The Apple Watch is excellent and the Fitness App is also good.  However the reporting/analytics using the Health App needs a lot of work.  It records the ‚Äònumbers‚Äô but there is no analysis.  The apps that track key metrics such as calorie intake (I.e. MyFitnessPal and and training readiness such as Athlytic are separate.

There is no native way to get the same info from the Health App.  Even basic fitness info such as calorie deficit or surplus have to be calculated manually.  The app also provides no insight or recommended adjustment to your fitness programme.

It‚Äôs a bit like having a spreadsheet with no formulas and no easy way to read reports.   So there are good foundations but little polish.

Other companies such as Fitbit (and I think Whoop) have managed to consolidate and report on this info.  I prefer Apple hardware and would like to stay within the Apple eco system especially with a Fitness or Health app that provided a single view.

I have found Athlytic to be the closet to Fitbit (and I believe Whoop) and it can reference the calorie info from MyFitness Pal and your workout data from Apple Health/Fitness apps.  This means it can easily show calorie surplus /deficit.  It also provides easy to read sleep analysis (using data from Apple health/Apple Watch).  The Athlytic subscription cost isn‚Äôt too expensive but I think either the Apple health app or fitness could provide the same features with some development - there is also the fact that I am already paying for the Fitness+ subscription.

Maybe Apple could buy/work with Athlytic and integrate  the features into the Apple Fitness app and keep the Health app as a ‚Äòbackground data collector‚Äô app?

The Analytics and reporting elements should also be available on iPads and Macs as they have larger screens and are easier to read .

Many thanks.
title: Poor for weight management and general Fitness Reporting

Personally I would like my parents to be able to see my health data at all times, however when I go to send it to them it says ‚Äòinvite pending‚Äô which it has done for several weeks. If anyone at Apple knows how to fix this, it would be amazing to know!
